pli-tv-pvr1.16:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.1: (1) As a result of having sexual intercourse, how many kinds of offences does one commit?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.2: One commits four kinds of offenses:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.3: when one has sexual intercourse with an undecomposed corpse, one commits an offense entailing expulsion;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.4: when one has sexual intercourse with a mostly decomposed corpse, one commits a serious offense;
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.5: when one inserts the penis without touching into a wide open mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.8: Of the four fallings away how many fallings away do these offences appertain to …
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.12: by how many decidings are they stopped?
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.13: Of the four fallings away these offences appertain to two fallings away:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.14: it may be that of falling away from moral habit, it may be that of falling away from good behaviour.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.15: Of the seven classes of offence they are comprised under four classes of offence:
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.16: it may he under the class of offence involving Defeat, it may be under the class of offence that is a very grave one, it may be under the class of offence of Expiation, it may be under the class of offence of wrong-doing.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:1.17: Of the six origins of offences …
pli-tv-pvr1.16:2.18: … and by a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.1: Concluded is the Eighth Chapter: that on Accumulation
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.2: Concluded are the eight Chapters on Because Of
pli-tv-pvr1.16:3.3: Concluded are the sixteen great Chapters in the Great Synopsis in the Great Analysis
